thread.title: NFL: Can 'Baja Oakland' Provide Raiders With a Home Field Advantage?
thread.title_full: NFL: Can 'Baja Oakland' Provide Raiders With a Home Field Advantage?

author: Michael Taylor
title: NFL: Can 'Baja Oakland' Provide Raiders With a Home Field Advantage?
text:
NFL: Can 'Baja Oakland' Provide Raiders With a Home Field Advantage? 
American Football 
The streets of the Gas Light were awash in silver and black Saturday night. And it was hard to distinguish the locals from the out-of-towners because THIS town has one of the largest Raider fan bases in the nation! Qualcom Stadium in San Diego. Photo Credit: John Scorza of the US Navy. 

Even though they have a football team of their own in this Southern California city, there is no shortage of Oakland Raiders fans in these parts. 
And I have that on GOOD evidence because I have BEEN to Baja Oakland – a.k.a. “San Diego”, “South Oakland”, and “Oakland South” (but NOT necessarily in that order). 
And I was amazed at how many passionate Oakland Raiders fans that beautiful town had. 
"I'm a Raiders fan," the waitress in the coffee shop of the hotel I was staying at announced when she arrived to take my order. 
"Oh really?" I replied, somewhat surprised. 
"There are a LOT of Raiders fans in this city!" 
Black Hole South 
So the big question now is, will there be more Raiders fans in Black Hole South – a.k.a. Qualcom Stadium – than Chargers fans? It HAS happened before. Let's give our Raiders a Home Field Advantage! 
This IS, after all, a Home Away from Home for the Raider Nation! 
The Chargers are 2 and 4. The Raiders are 2 and 3. Can the Raiders emerge from game 6 in week 7 of the 2015 NFL season with an even split?
